decks.notes: The deck focuses on using powerful control cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Mass Manipulation to dominate the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also utilizes ramp cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Paradise Druid to quickly cast big threats like Hydroid Krasis. The deck aims to control the game early on with counterspells and removal, then overwhelm the opponent with large creatures and powerful spells in the late game. The key strategy is to maintain board control while ramping up to play high-impact cards and win through sheer card advantage and tempo.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and planeswalkers to disrupt the opponent's strategy. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to prevent the opponent from executing their game plan while gaining card advantage through Narset, Parter of Veils and Search for Azcanta. Command the Dreadhorde and The Elderspell provide powerful late game finishers, while cards like Kaya's Wrath and Thought Erasure help to maintain board control and disrupt the opponent's hand.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly bring out aggressive creatures like Tenth District Legionnaire, Legion Warboss, and Feather, the Redeemed, while using spells like Shock, Reckless Rage, and Defiant Strike to control the board and protect your creatures. With the ability to abuse Feather's exile and return mechanic with spells, the deck maintains a steady stream of threats and removal. Gideon Blackblade and Ajani, Adversary of Tyrants provide additional support and buffs to your creatures, allowing you to quickly overwhelm your opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive playstyle with a mix of creatures and burn spells to quickly finish off the opponent. By utilizing cards like Gruul Spellbreaker and Rekindling Phoenix, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain board control. The inclusion of Domri, Chaos Bringer and Domri, Anarch of Bolas provides additional support and card advantage. With a solid mana base and a mixture of powerful creatures and removal spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy and maintaining board presence. This is achieved through a combination of hand disruption and removal spells like Thought Erasure, Vraska's Contempt, and Angrath's Rampage. The deck also has powerful planeswalkers such as Nicol Bolas, the Ravager and Liliana, Dreadhorde General, which can generate card advantage and dominate the battlefield. The inclusion of counterspells like Negate and the versatility of Bedeck / Bedazzle add another layer of control and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to control the game until it can establish a dominant position and close out the victory.

The deck focuses on control and utilizing Simic colors to control the board and manipulate gameplay. It includes cards that allow for card advantage and ramping, such as Growth Spiral and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales. The deck aims to stall the opponent's aggression with cards like Root Snare and maintain board presence with cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World. It also includes ways to continuously take extra turns with Nexus of Fate. The deck's strategy is to outvalue the opponent and eventually win through overwhelming card advantage and board control.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with creatures like Paradise Druid and Llanowar Elves to play powerful Planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. It aims to control the game through counterspells and removal spells while generating a large amount of card advantage with cards like Growth Spiral and Hydroid Krasis. The deck also includes Mass Manipulation to take control of opponent's creatures and Finale of Glory to create a large army for the final push. The key strategy is to outvalue opponents with powerful threats and efficient control spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions and resources through a combination of discard spells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Nicol Bolas. By disrupting the opponent's strategy and maintaining board control, the deck aims to grind out incremental advantages until it can establish a dominant position. The deck also has a strong late-game presence with powerful finishers like Ugin, the Ineffable and Nicol Bolas, Dragon-God. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue the opponent and win through attrition and strategic decision-making.

This deck aims to flood the board with mana-producing creatures like Llanowar Elves and Paradise Druid, ramping up quickly to play powerful threats like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Hydroid Krasis. Cards like Prison Realm and The Immortal Sun help control the board and protect your creatures, while Teferi, Time Raveler provides extra utility. The deck also includes ways to gain life and generate tokens to overwhelm the opponent. The strategy revolves around fast mana acceleration, big creatures, and disruption to outpace and outvalue the opponent.

This Bant Control deck focuses on ramping into powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis and Nissa, Who Shakes the World while controlling the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Mass Manipulation. The deck aims to generate value through card draw and mana acceleration, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with a combination of large creatures and disruptive spells. The inclusion of Finale of Glory and Finale of Devastation provides additional win conditions and flexibility in adapting to different board states. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through careful resource management and strategic plays.

The main concept of this Bant Control deck is to establish board control through a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Nissa and Teferi, along with creatures like Hydroid Krasis and Incubation Druid. The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with mana dorks like Llanowar Elves and Paradise Druid, allowing for big plays like Mass Manipulation and Entrancing Melody to take over the game. Frilled Mystic provides additional control elements, while the mana base of various shock and check lands ensures consistent mana fixing for the deck's spells.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using powerful spells like Mass Manipulation and Entrancing Melody to steal your opponent's creatures. Teferi, Time Raveler is used to disrupt your opponent's game plan while Nissa, Who Shakes the World helps ramp up mana and make powerful land creatures. The deck also includes card draw with Growth Spiral and Hydroid Krasis, and mana acceleration with Llanowar Elves and Arboreal Grazer. The mana base is designed to support both green and blue spells, ensuring a balanced control strategy.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures quickly to overwhelm the opponent with strong attacks. The key strategy is to ramp up mana production with Paradise Druid and Llanowar Elves to play powerful creatures like Rekindling Phoenix, Regisaur Alpha, and Ghalta, Primal Hunger, while also disrupting the opponent with cards like Gruul Spellbreaker and Domri, Anarch of Bolas. The goal is to maintain pressure on the opponent and finish the game quickly before they can establish their own game plan.

The main focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Paradise Druid and Llanowar Elves, while also utilizing aggressive creatures like Gruul Spellbreaker and Rekindling Phoenix to deal damage to the opponent. Domri, Anarch of Bolas provides additional card advantage and deck manipulation, while cards like Shock and Lightning Strike help to control the board. Nullhide Ferox and Growth-Chamber Guardian offer resilience and consistency to ensure a fast and aggressive playstyle that aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to react.

The focus of this Simic Control deck is to establish early mana ramp with cards like Llanowar Elves and Paradise Druid, enabling the player to quickly play powerful threats like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Hydroid Krasis. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counterspells like Frilled Mystic and removal spells like Entrancing Melody. The end game plan is to utilize Mass Manipulation to take control of key opponent's creatures or permanents, swinging the game in the player's favor. The deck aims to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and spells.

The deck focuses on maintaining control of the game through a combination of card draw, mana ramp, and powerful creatures in order to outvalue the opponent. By utilizing cards like Nexus of Fate and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales, the deck aims to manipulate the flow of the game and consistently generate card advantage. Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Hydroid Krasis serve as win conditions, ensuring that the deck can close out games once it has established a dominant position on the battlefield. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistent access to its key cards while also providing flexibility for various board states.
